crypto.name: Baby Crypto
crypto.desc:
I found this weird string, do you know what it means?

whuo{squi4h_s1fx3h_v0h_co_i4b4T}

crypto.name: EncryptService
crypto.desc: I have created an encryption service that encrypts anything you want multiple times

crypto.name: Fancy
crypto.desc: All these crypto protocol are not elegant at all. So I created a fancy encryption

crypto.name: GreyCat Trial
crypto.desc: In the sacred realm of GreyCat, amidst the swirling mists of arcane power, a momentous trial unfolds, seeking the one destined to bear the mantle of the next mighty GreyCat wizard.

crypto.name: PLCG
crypto.desc: Add some probability to spice up the game

crypto.name: The Vault
crypto.desc: Can you break into a double-encrypted vault?

pwn.name: Easy Pwn
pwn.desc: Well, it's just a small binary. Can you pwn it without running the executable?

pwn.name: MonkeyType
pwn.desc:
monkeytype is overrated.

stty -icanon -echo ; nc 34.124.157.94 12321; stty sane

Note: Type q to quit.

pwn.name: Read me a Book
pwn.desc: Welcome to the library of hopes and dreams... Read me a book and all your dreams might come true :)

pwn.name: Write me a Book
pwn.desc:
Give back to the library! Share your thoughts and experiences!

The flag can be found in /flag

pwn.name: arraystore
pwn.desc: Simple array store with 100 entries, what can go wrong?

rev.name: ReService
rev.desc:
I found this file that was installed by the virus. Can you find out what it does?

It seems to connect to a c2 server and makes use of the current time.

rev.name: Web-Assembly
rev.desc: Handwriting assembly code is a bad idea...

rev.name: crackme2
rev.desc:
Hope you like this.

Update: The previous version of crackme2 is unstable. Please download the latest version here.

If you aren't using Ubuntu 22.04, you will have to use the supplied libc, by downloading the libc and ld binary into the same directory as the crackme binary.

LD_LIBRARY_PATH=. ./ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 ./crackme2-2 "grey{aaa}"

You may consider using pwninit so that you can run the binary directly without the long line above.

Update 2: crackme2-old is the previous version that is unstable. You may use this if you do not want to use ld to run the binary.

Also, the flag format is grey{...} instead of greyctf{...} as mentioned by the program.

rev.name: crackme3
rev.desc: If you didn't like the previous 2, I don't think you will like this.

web.name: 100 Questions
web.desc: I love doing practice papers! There are 100 questions, but the answers to some are more important than others...

web.name: Baby Web
web.desc: This website seems to have an issue. Let's report it to the admins.

web.name: Login Bot
web.desc:
I made a reverse blog where anyone can blog but only I can see it (Opposite of me blogging and everyone seeing). You can post your content with my bot and I'll read it.

Sometimes weird errors happen and the bot gets stuck. I've fixed it now so it should work!

web.name: Microservices
web.desc:
I just learnt about microservices. That means my internal server is safe now right?

I'm still making my website but you can have a free preview

web.name: Microservices Revenge
web.desc: I've upgraded the security of this website and added a new feature. Can you still break it?

web.name: Sort It Out
web.desc: I enrolled in a data structures class in order to buff up my programming skills to complete my Indie Anime Stealth Action Video Game. I'm learning about sorting algorithms and their various time complexities now. Cool stuff!

web.name: View My Albums
web.desc: My RateYourMusic competitor will take off any day now. I just need to add rating... and CSS... and images... and a bunch of other things
